description: mounted on ivory paper with red-brown borders; face with wide open, wild eyes, open mouth with teeth visible and unkempt hair
inscription:
Inscription

on verso, in pen and ink: \"Wessner\" / gr. 13; in a different hand: \"[d]i Michelangelo\"; in graphite: \"D.R. / 72/ 69 [crossed out]\"
provenance: I. O. Wessner, Lugt 2562a (1851-1921), Saint-Gall, Switzlerland; [Kate Ganz, London, by 1992-93; sold, July 13, for $5,000, to Moir]; Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (1993-d.2010; gave to MIA)
title: Self-Portrait Screaming in Terror
